challenges.title: Subtract Whole Numbers
description: Subtracting whole numbers is the opposite of adding them. So, if you add two numbers together, then subtract one of the original addends, you will end up with the other addend. When you add numbers, you get the sum. When you subtract numbers, you get the difference. Here's an example:
When subtracting, it can be helpful to rewrite the problem vertically. Be sure to line up the numbers by place value. <math>\begin{array}{}& 26 \\- & ~9 \\\hline& ? \\ \end{array}</math>

challenges.title: Estimate Whole Number Sums and Differences
description: Estimation means finding an answer that is reasonably close to the exact answer. Estimation is useful in situations where an exact answer is not needed. The first step in estimating a sum or difference is to round the numbers to the nearest power of ten.
Here is how rounding helps when estimating, consider the following problem:

Since these numbers are relatively small, it would be simplest to round to the nearest ten. 516 rounds up to 520 and 132 rounds down to 130. Now, it's simple to sum the rounded numbers: 520 + 130 = 650
Remember, estimation has to make sense for the given situation. If a precise answer is required, you should not use estimation.
